Basic details: Emily Carter, a 32-year-old female, comes to the clinic complaining of unexplained weight gain.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 76/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit in the chair and appear slightly anxious about the weight gain.
Mention feeling more tired than usual and having some swelling in the ankles.
If thyroid function tests are mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What do they test for?”
Challenging question: “Could this weight gain be due to a hormonal problem?”
